items.title: Senate Passes Critical Minerals Security Act with Bipartisan Support
items.summary: The U.S. Senate voted 78-22 to pass legislation aimed at securing domestic supply chains for critical minerals including lithium, cobalt, and rare earth elements...
items.why_it_matters: Major legislative momentum for domestic mining | Includes $2.5B in federal funding for permitting reform | Could accelerate project timelines by 3-5 years
items.clearpath_angle: STRATEGIC VALUE: Aligns with ClearPath advocacy for energy infrastructure permitting reform | CONSIDER: Draft memo on how minerals permitting fits into broader energy project acceleration efforts

items.title: China Announces Export Quotas on Graphite, Rare Earths
items.summary: China's Ministry of Commerce unveiled new quarterly export quotas on battery-grade graphite and rare earth minerals, tightening global supply constraints...
items.why_it_matters: Further evidence of China's strategic resource control | Could accelerate US/allied efforts to develop alternative supply chains | Battery costs may increase 5-8% near-term
items.clearpath_angle: STRATEGIC VALUE: Strengthens case for domestic production and allied partnerships | CONSIDER: Update policy team on implications for EV supply chain security and potential administration responses

items.title: First Lithium Mine in Nevada Receives Final Permit Approval
items.summary: The Bureau of Land Management granted final approval for the Thunder Basin Lithium Project in Nevada, marking the first new lithium mine permitted in the U.S. in over a decade...
items.why_it_matters: Proof-of-concept for permitting reform success | Project could supply 30% of domestic lithium demand by 2028 | Demonstrates feasibility of expedited environmental review
items.clearpath_angle: STRATEGIC VALUE: Excellent case study for permitting reform advocacy | CONSIDER: Interview project developers for testimony/white paper on what worked in their permitting process
